competitors.name: Hewlett-Packard
competitors.notes: Major competitor in hardware, servers, storage, and IT services

competitors.name: Dell
competitors.notes: Competitor in hardware infrastructure, servers, and storage

competitors.name: Accenture
competitors.notes: Leading competitor in IT consulting and digital transformation

competitors.name: Microsoft
competitors.notes: Competitor in enterprise software, cloud services (Azure launched 2010)

competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Competitor in enterprise software, databases, hardware (after Sun acquisition)

competitors.name: Google
competitors.notes: Competitor in cloud services and emerging AI/analytics

competitors.name: Cisco Systems
competitors.notes: Competitor in networking infrastructure and cybersecurity

competitors.name: SAP
competitors.notes: Competitor in enterprise software and business applications

context: In 2010, IBM was heavily focused on software solutions, middleware, databases, and analytics. Microsoft Azure was launched in 2010, marking increased competition in cloud computing. IBM was developing Watson.
